properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow continue. Blizzard conditions continue in Resolute with strong easterly winds, gusting up to 80 km/h. Blizzard conditions will end by this afternoon as the wind weakens. However, periods of blowing snow may continue into Monday evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-15T21:59:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T08:42:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1248120204.2020
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong westerly winds gusting to 70-80 km/h will produce widespread blizzard conditions that will last through Sunday. At Sachs Harbour, gusts are expected to peak early Sunday morning, with gusts to 90 km/h possible. At Paulatuk, gusts are expected to peak early Sunday morning, with gusts to 120 km/h possible. Blizzard conditions should end at Tuktoyaktuk on Sunday morning and over the remainder of the regions by Sunday evening. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-15T13:19:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-14T21:20:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1155833039.2020
Area: Sachs Harbour, Ulukhaktok, Paulatuk, Tuktoyaktuk - East Channel Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected. Blizzard conditions are expected to develop in Gjoa Haven Sunday evening as the wind strengthens from the northeast. Conditions will improve early Monday morning when the wind weakens. In addition, some occasional blowing snow is expected tonight and tomorrow in Gjoa Haven. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-15T18:01:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T02:02:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0348315703.2020
Area: Gjoa Haven

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Gusty easterly winds will combine with cold arctic air to produce wind chill values near minus 35 for Yoho Park - Kootenay Park this morning.. Conditions will improve later today. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T03:00:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T11:01:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2038625813.2020
Area: Yoho Park - Kootenay Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills continues. Extreme cold wind chill values near minus 40 are occurring this morning. Conditions will moderate this afternoon as temperatures rise. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-15T20:59:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T10:29:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0320771196.2020

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Arctic outflow winds of 80 km/h gusting to 100 will blow over southern sections of Howe Sound including Bowen Island this morning. Winds will ease starting late this morning. Wind speeds will increase again tonight over southern sections of Howe Sound but they will stay well below warning criteria. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T03:26:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T11:27:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4008715479.2020
Area: Howe Sound
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Further snowfall: near 10 cm, except 2 to 5 cm in the Nain and Natuashish areas. Maximum wind gusts: 80 to 90 km/h. Locations: Labrador coast from Nain to Black Tickle. Time span: continuing until midday Sunday, except improving tonight over northernmost areas. Remarks: Snow will taper off tonight in the Nain and Natuashish areas, and during the morning on Sunday from Hopedale to Rigolet. Northeasterly winds will strengthen this evening over most areas and shift to strong northwesterlies by morning. The winds will ease during the day on Sunday. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-15T16:59:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T01:10:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2691262875.2020
Area: Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h. Locations: Labrador coast from Hopedale to Black Tickle. Time span: continuing until midday today. Remarks: Snow will taper off during the morning and winds will gradually ease during the day today. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
